column2: What town/city do you live in?
column3: Do you currently interact with your city government?
column4: If "YES," how do you interact with your city government? Please select all that apply.
column5: Do you feel like you are kept in the loop on the decisions made by your local government?
column6: How do you keep in the loop on decisions and policies made by your local government?
column7: Do you feel that your local government's decisions are in your best interest?
column8: Why do you feel that way?
I feel that it’s an echo chamber for a select few who’s ttend meetings and are able to pay attention diligently to many meetings

I feel that the community is always able to give their input and a community the size of Carrboro can be vocal on their needs and desires which will inevitably be heard by the local government themselves
I’m a white woman in chapel hill...I feel like I’m basically the type of person whose interests they care about.
The town in general gets more scrutiny now than ever before because of social media, so transparency is the reason I feel that way
Equity in Chapel Hill still has a long way to go.
They keep tearing down things and building other things and taking other local businesses with corporations.
Busy and no one is providing the information to me
So far they have done well
It depends but there are ties where the government worries more about keeping itself afloat
I’m not sure of them honestly
They aren’t using the bond money for what we voted for.
I believe people naturally want things to be better!
Schools are not what they should be; the government is unnecessarily spending money on other projects when they should be investing in education.
